body_html: Ack, merging was the right way to go... I've looked in the implementation of contextlib.py for Python 3.5 and 3.6. While there are some small diffs, I can't see anything that looked relevant. My hunch is that there's something special about RuntimeError (since it gets used internally in the contextlib implementation), but I didn't find a smoking gun.
body_text: Ack, merging was the right way to go... I've looked in the implementation of contextlib.py for Python 3.5 and 3.6. While there are some small diffs, I can't see anything that looked relevant. body: Ack, merging was the right way to go... I've looked in the implementation of `contextlib.py` for Python [3.5](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/3.5/Lib/contextlib.py) and [3.6](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/3.6/Lib/contextlib.py). While there are some small diffs, I can't see anything that looked relevant. My hunch is that there's something special about `RuntimeError` (since it gets used internally in the `contextlib` implementation), but I didn't find a smoking gun.
